page.title: 06LIVING IN THE AREA
page.content: Most of the Otham people interviewed said they preferred Otham to nearby Parkwood because it was far cleaner and quieter, though they did have transport problems and there were no shops. There is much woodland and farmland in the parish, however, and the amenities include a cricket ground, a pub and a telephone box. Many Parkwood residents agreed as to how their area has changed in recent years. They felt it was now noisier, dirtier, and far more industrialized, but, though it has more traffic, transport is better and there are more shops. Boughton Monchelsea is an old-established village surrounded by farmland; it ahs retained a couple of shops. The residents seem to find it a pleasant place to live and a happy community.
